026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns;
027
028import java.util.logging.Logger;
029
030import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
031import com.ibm.streams.operator.OutputTuple;
032import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingData.Punctuation;
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingOutput;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.logging.TraceLevel;
035import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.Parameter;
036import com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.state.Counter;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.state.ConsistentRegionContext;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.state.DelegateStateHandler;
039
040/**
041 * Abstract pattern class for an operator that produces a single tuple
042 * periodically on a single output port.
043 * This class extends PollingTupleProducer
044 * by providing an implementation of fetchTuples() which calls
045 * fetchSingleTuple at the polling frequency. Sub-classes provide an
046 * implementation of fetchSingleTuple to set the tuple's attribute values.
047 * 
048 * <P>
049 * If the operator parameter <code>iterations</code> is set then it is taken as the
050 * number of tuples that will be submitted. If not set or if sub-classes
051 * do not call setIterations() then the operator will run until the job is
052 * terminated.
053 * </P>
054 */
055public abstract class PollingSingleTupleProducer extends PollingTupleProducer {
056
057
058    /**
059     * SPL Trace facility
060     */
061    private final static Logger trace = Logger.getLogger(PollingSingleTupleProducer.class.getName());
062
063    /**
064     * Number of tuples to submit, -1 means submit until the operator is
065     * terminated.
066     */
067    private int iterations = -1;
068    
069    /**
070     * Number of tuples submitted so far.
071     */
072    private Counter counter;
073
074    /**
075     * {@inheritDoc}
076     * <P>
077     * Sets the number of iterations from the operator parameter <code>iterations</code> 
078     * </P>
079     */
080    @Override
081    public synchronized void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
082        super.initialize(context);
083        counter = new Counter();
084        context.registerStateHandler(getStateHandler(counter));
085    }
086    
087    protected DelegateStateHandler<Counter> getStateHandler(Counter counter) {
088        return new DelegateStateHandler<Counter>(counter);
089    }
090    
091    /**
092     * Set the number of iterations.
093     * @param iterations Number of tuples to submit, -1 means submit tuples until
094     * the job is terminated.
095     */
096    @Parameter(optional=true,
097            description="The number of tuples to submit. Negative value or zero means continually fetch and submit tuples.")
098    public synchronized final void setIterations(int iterations) {
099        if (iterations < 0)
100            iterations = -1;
101        trace.log(TraceLevel.DEBUG, "iterations=" + iterations);
102        this.iterations = iterations;
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Call {@link #fetchSingleTuple(OutputTuple)} to allow a sub-class to submit
107     * a tuple. Keeps track of the number of tuples submitted
108     * and if the number to submit has been limited then complete()
109     * is called to terminate the periodic call of this method,
110     * and then a window and final punctuation marks are submitted.
111     * 
112     */
113    @Override
114    protected synchronized void fetchTuples() throws Exception {
115        
116        if (iterations != -1 && counter.getCount() == iterations)
117            return;
118        
119        final StreamingOutput<OutputTuple> output = getOutput(0);
120
121        final OutputTuple tuple = output.newTuple();
122        
123        if (fetchSingleTuple(tuple))
124            output.submit(tuple);
125        else
126            return;
127
128        if (iterations != -1) {
129            if (counter.increment() == iterations) {
130                trace.log(TraceLevel.DEBUG, "Complete - sending window & final marks");
131                output.punctuate(Punctuation.WINDOW_MARKER);
132                completedTuples();
133            }
134        }
135    }
136    
137    /**
138     * Complete the operator. Called when the parameter
139     * {@link #setIterations(int) iterations} is set and the
140     * required number of tuples has been submitted.
141     * Terminates the polling task by calling
142     * {@link PollingTupleProducer#complete() super.complete()}.
143     * <BR>
144     * If this operator is in a consistent region then before
145     * terminating the polling task, we must ensure all
146     * of the tuples have been processed, by calling
147     * {@link ConsistentRegionContext#makeConsistent()}.
148     * If a failure occurred a reset will have occurred and
149     * we must continue to send tuples as, as the count of
150     * submitted tuples will have been reset. Thus
151     * if {@code makeConsistent()} returns {@code false} then
152     * {@code super.complete()} is not called.
153     */
154    protected void completedTuples() throws Exception {
155        ConsistentRegionContext crc = getOperatorContext().getOptionalContext(ConsistentRegionContext.class);
156        if (crc != null) {
157            // In a consistent region
158            if (!crc.makeConsistent())
159                return;
160            
161        } else {
162            getOutput(0).punctuate(Punctuation.FINAL_MARKER);
163        }
164        
165        // cancel the repeating task
166        super.complete();
167    }
168    
169    /**
170     * Fetch the information for the tuple and set its attributes.
171     * Return true to submit the tuple to the output port, false
172     * to not send. Only submitted tuples are counted against the
173     * number of iterations.
174     * <P>
175     * When in a {@link ConsistentRegionContext consistent region} a
176     * submission permit is acquired before {@code fetchSingleTuple()} is
177     * invoked and released once it completes.
178     * </P>
179
180     * @param tuple Tuple to be submitted.
181     * @return True to submit the tuple, false to not submit.
182     */
183    protected abstract boolean fetchSingleTuple(OutputTuple tuple) throws Exception;
184}
